item.title: RS glitch and apeales
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Well, first of all the glitch is easily explained by anyone who knows something about Java, and who has inspected the RS client:

The client is designed specifically to make things change color of they start with @ and end with @, and have 3 letters in the middle. That is actually what provides chat effects in the game:

You type: red: This will be red text.
The server sees: “red: This will be red text”
The server tells all the clients to say “@red@This will be red text”
The clients see “@red@” and they convert the chat to red before displaying it.

Here are more

@whi@
@cya@
@cr1@
@cr2@
@gre@
@lre@

However, I do not know anything about their appealBot, sorry.

Read full topic

item.title: RS glitch and apeales
item.dc:creator: @O_M_F_G O M F G
item.description:
@O_M_F_G wrote:

The glitch:
On the login screen where your user name is supposed to be you can type the following for interesting events, type notin for pass, dont log on
@bla-text flashes blk
@blu-text flashes blue
@red-text flashes red
@yel-text flashes yellow
@str-“Username:” gets crossed out

A little known fact about text coloring:
cyan: gives blue text, Im saying this because I only figured it out yesterday and blue: doesn’t work unlike the other text coloring like glow2: or red:

I’ve heard that the ban apeal system apeals under a sertain sentance structure, if any one knows what it is please post, as I’m shure that any one on this site will find it useful as most people have goten caught macroing at least once or got an offence for some other rule.

Read full topic
